newsitem.title: USA: White House support helicopter crashes in Florida.
newsitem.headline: White House support helicopter crashes in Florida.

text.p: A helicopter used in supporting the entourage of President Bill Clinton crashed in Orlando on Friday but all crew members escaped without injury, White House spokesman Mike McCurry told reporters.

Defence department officials in Washington said preliminary reports were that it was a CH-46E Seaknight Marine helicopter used in supporting presidential trips. It was landing at Orlando Executive Airport when the accident happened.
"It rolled over and apparently was destroyed in a fire at the Orlando Executive Airport," McCurry told reporters in Orlando. "All crew members escaped without injury."

Clinton, in Florida on a two-day election campaign trip, was elsewhere in Orlando when the accident happened. The helicopter was used on Thursday to transport members of the presidential party but not Clinton.

It was the second air accident involving support for the president in three weeks. A C-130 Air Force cargo plane that accompanied Clinton on his vacation trip to Jackson, Wyoming, crashed on a Wyoming mountain on Aug. 17, killing all nine people aboard. Eight were crew members and one was a Secret Service agent.
